# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
1 | % { SWITCH (0) { DEFAULT { $_ } } }
```

# Expected behavior

```none
1
```

# Actual behavior

```none
0
```

# Environment data


comments.author: thlac
comments.body: I don't think this is an issue, the switch statement sets $PSItem to the value passed into the switch which is 0 in this case.

comments.author: yecril71pl
comments.body: This behaviour is undocumented.  The automatic variable $_ is documented to be set by commands, the SWITCH statement is not a command.

comments.author: thlac
comments.body: Ah right, the switch statement is documented to set it, but it does look to be inconsistent with the documentation regarding $PSItem/$_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: The design is explicitly documented now.

title: SWITCH statement overrides automatic variable $_
